snippet: At current or foreseeable gas prices, it would take many years for the fuel savings from hybrid and plug-in cars to make up for the cars’ high initial cost.
abstract: Automotive data suggests that, at current or foreseeable gas prices, it would take many years, in some cases more than a decade, for the fuel savings from hybrid and plug-in cars to make up for the cars’ high initial cost; gas would have to approach $8 a gallon before many of the cars could be expected to pay off in the six years an average person owns a car; added cost is limiting the ability of the vehicles to gain broader appeal.
lead_paragraph: At current or foreseeable gas prices, it would take many years for the fuel savings from hybrid and plug-in cars to make up for the cars’ high initial cost.

headline.seo: For Hybrid and Electric Cars to Pay Off, Owners Must Wait
headline.main: Payoff for Efficient Cars Takes Years
